div.l: Than þat it rote all þe remenᵃaunte
So fareth it bi a riotous ʆseruᵃaunt
It is lasse harme to late him passe
Þan he shende all þe ʆseruant in þe place
There for his maister yaf him acquitance
And bade him go with sorewe ⁊and myschaunce
And þus þis Ioly prentise hadde his leve
Now late hīm riot al þe night or leve
And for þere is no þef with outen a look
Þat helpeth him to wasten or to sowk
Of þat he brak can or borow may
Anon he sent his bed ⁊and his aray
Vnto a conꝑper of his owne sorte
Þat loued þis reuell and disporte
And had a wife þat held for contenᵃaunce
A shop and swifed for his sustenᵃaunce
But her͗e of I will passe as nowe
And of yong Gamelyne I will tell yowe
Sit and lysthen̄ ⁊and herkeneth a right
And ye shal her͗e of a doughti knight
Sir Iohn of Burdes was his name
He couth of norture ⁊and of mychel game
Þre sōnnes þe kniȝt had and wᵗith his body he hem wan̄
Þe eldest was a moche shriwe ⁊and sone he bigan
His bretheren loued wele hir fader ⁊and of hīm wer͗e a gast
Þe eldest deʆserued his fader corse ⁊and had it atte last
Þis goode knight his fader loued so yore
Þat deth was cōmmen hīm to ⁊and handel hīm ful sore
Þe good knight kared sore ⁊and siketh þer͗e he lay
How his childeren shuld leuen aftre his day
He had ben wide wher͗e but non husbond he was
All þe londe þat he hadde it was purchas
Fayne he wold it wer͗e dressed among hem all
Þat eche of hem had his part as it might falll
Þo sente he into contre aftre wise knightes
To help dele his londe and dressen hem to rightes
He send hem worde bi letras þey shuld hie beleue
If þei wold speke with hīm whiles he was on lyve
The knightes herd sike þat he lay
Had þei no rest nyght noþer day
Til þei come to him þer͗e he lay still
On his deth bed to abide godꝭes will
Þen seid þe good knight sike þer͗e he la
